alert.note: Alert for Lexington; Newberry; Richland; Saluda (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 6:53PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Newberry, northwestern Lexington, northeastern Saluda and northwestern Richland Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 653 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Saluda to near Dreher Island State Park. These storms were nearly stationary. ...Boaters on Lake Murray Should Seek Safe Harbor... HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lexington, Irmo, Highway 6 at Lake Murray Dam, Prosperity, Dreher Island State Park, Ballentine, Chapin, Little Mountain, Silverstreet, Cedar Grove Fire Station, South Shore Marina, Oswald Park, Bundrick Island, Putnam`s Landing, White Rock, Rocky Point Recreation Area, Hollywood Elementary School, Hollow Creek Public Park, Melvin Park and Lighthouse Marina. This includes Interstate 26 between mile markers 85 and 98. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If on or near Lake Murray, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
